context: right argon laser assisted stapedectomy.
bilateral conductive hearing losses with right stapedial fixation secondary to otosclerosis.
bilateral conductive hearing losses with right stapedial fixation secondary to otosclerosis.
bilateral conductive hearing losses with right stapedial fixation secondary to otosclerosis.
bilateral progressive conductive hearing losses with probable otosclerosis.
bilateral progressive conductive hearing losses with probable otosclerosis.
endotracheal intubation carried out by dr. x.
slow infiltration of the external canal accomplished with 1% xylocaine with epinephrine.
a limited incision was made in the earlobe harvesting a small bit of fat from the earlobe that was diced and the donor site closed with interrupted sutures of 5-0 nylon.
a 65 beaver blade was used to make incision both at 12 o'clock and at 6 o'clock.
jordan round knife was used to incise the tympanomeatal flap with an adequate cuff for later reapproximation.
an annulus elevator was used to complete the elevation beneath the annular ligament.
a house curette was used to takedown portions of the scutum with extreme care to avoid any inadvertent trauma to the chorda tympani.
argon laser then used to create rosette on the posterior cruse.
the stapes superstructure anteriorly was mobilized with a right angle hook at the incostapedial joint and the superstructure could then be downfractured.
a small bit of additional footplate was removed with a right angle hook to accommodate the 0.6 mm piston.

text: 4.25 mm slim shaft wire teflon piston
context: the measuring device was used and a 4.25 mm slim shaft wire teflon piston chosen.
a downbiting crimper was then used to complete the attachment of the prosthesis to the incus.
the external canal packed with small pledgets of gelfoam and antibiotic ointment.
